direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods set the argument count based on a boolean condition, but 'hasArg(boolean)' allows for more flexibility by accepting a boolean parameter.
Both methods set the argument count, but 'hasArgs()' sets it to unlimited values, while 'hasArg()' sets it to a single argument.
Both methods set the argument count and optional argument flag, but 'hasOptionalArg()' explicitly sets the optional argument flag to true.
Both methods modify the state of the OptionBuilder by setting a boolean flag, but 'isRequired()' sets the required flag instead of the argument count.
Both methods modify the state of the OptionBuilder by setting a string value, but 'withArgName(String)' sets the argument name instead of the argument count.

enhanced_by.reason: Both methods modify the state of the OptionBuilder, but 'reset()' resets all properties to their default values, which can be useful for setting up a clean state before testing 'hasArg()'.
The 'create()' method is invoked after setting up the OptionBuilder properties, including the argument count set by 'hasArg()', making it a logical method to call in the 'When' phase of testing.
The 'hasArg()' method can be used to verify that the argument count has been set correctly, which is a key assertion in the 'Then' phase of testing.
